column5: Vous pourriez vouloir polir vers le haut sur votre français ..... si vous avez été là pendant 20 années peut-être toi le besoin de demander à quelqu'un du camp que vous restez à. Que diriez-vous de toi juste faites-le et puis le signalez en arrière dessus ici avec combien l'amende coûtait du billet ! `Heureux de Fishin Walley or you could try this link http://education.mrnf.gouv.qc.ca/
thanks I found what i was looking for A nonres. cant even sleep in your boat unless you have a camp permit
can you camp for the nite on islands or would i have to sleep in boat would like to try fishing at nite? thanks

If you are a resident you could. A non-resident would legally have to buy a camping permit if the island was crown land, they are $10/day/person. Are you staying at a resort and just spending one night out? If you are camping you can only have a conservation lisense so I don't know how that would work if you were paying for the resort but camping anyway?
yes staying at a camp just wanted to spend one nite on a island can sleep in boat but nice to have acamp fire and sleep in tent.
This is in Quebec and not Ontario...Correct?? are the laws the same in each provience?
I thought that I read that a non-resident don't need an overnight camping permit if you have something rented that night. don't recall if ON or QC.
yes in quebec it is crown land. thanks for any info.

Man, if you are going to be camping in your boat, I'd suggest you do it either really early in the season, or mid-Sep or later. The bugs (especially mosquitoes) in most north woods environments can literally drove a person crazy once the breeze lets up in the evening. Bill

Have you been there before? Most of the islands that I have seen there are pretty rocky around the shore-line and would make landing a boat challenging. Not that it couldn't be done, but I didn't see may nice sandy beach landings. It's a huge place so you might know of areas that I haven't even come close to seeing.

there are several sandy "beach" places on DeCelles, IF you know where to go, because it IS a large area.My question is....In Quebec, IF you want to just go out and camp at a lake in the bush, do you need a camping permit, I know you do in Ontario but what about Quebec?
yes ive been there every year for about 20 years. I know were sandy beaches are im aware of the bugs. just wanted to know if I could build a fire and sleep on an island in there. thanks.
